metadata.description: Comprehensive ls option documentation for eza_ls wrapper

options.name: one_per_line
options.bsd_desc: (The numeric digit "one".) Force output to be one entry per line. This is the default when output is not to a terminal.
options.gnu_desc: list one file per line
options.notes: Forces output one entry per line

options.name: show_hidden
options.bsd_desc: Include directory entries whose names begin with a dot ('.').
options.gnu_desc: do not ignore entries starting with .
options.notes: Include directory entries starting with . (including . and ..)

options.name: almost_all
options.bsd_desc: Include directory entries whose names begin with a dot ('.') except for . and ... Automatically set for the super-user unless -I is specified.
options.gnu_desc: do not list implied . and ..

options.name: ignore_backups
options.gnu_desc: do not list implied entries ending with ~

options.name: ctime_sort
options.bsd_desc: Use time when file status was last changed for sorting or printing.
options.gnu_desc: with -lt: sort by, and show, ctime (time of last change of file status information); with -l: show ctime and sort by name; otherwise: sort by ctime, newest first
options.notes: Use time when file status was last changed

options.name: columns
options.bsd_desc: Force multi-column output; this is the default when output is to a terminal.
options.gnu_desc: list entries by columns

options.name: color
options.bsd_desc: Output colored escape sequences based on when, which may be set to either always, auto, or never.
options.gnu_desc: color the output WHEN; more info below

options.name: dirs_files
options.bsd_desc: Directories are listed as plain files (not searched recursively).
options.gnu_desc: list directories themselves, not their contents
options.notes: List directories themselves, not their contents

options.name: date_format
options.bsd_desc: When printing in the long (-l) format, use format to format the date and time output

options.name: no_sort
options.bsd_desc: Output is not sorted. This option turns on -a. It also negates the effect of the -r, -S and -t options.
options.gnu_desc: do not sort directory entries

options.name: classify
options.bsd_desc: Display a slash ('/') immediately after each pathname that is a directory, an asterisk ('*') after each that is executable, an at sign ('@') after each symbolic link, an equals sign ('=') after each socket, a percent sign ('%') after each whiteout, and a vertical bar ('|') after each that is a FIFO.
options.gnu_desc: append indicator (one of */=>@|) to entries WHEN

options.name: filetype
options.gnu_desc: likewise, except do not append '*'
options.notes: Like -F but don't append * to executables

options.name: no_owner
options.bsd_desc: This option has no effect. It is only available for compatibility with 4.3BSD.
options.gnu_desc: like -l, but do not list owner
options.notes: GNU: long format without owner. BSD: no effect (compat)

options.name: no_group_names
options.gnu_desc: in a long listing, don't print group names

options.name: human
options.bsd_desc: When used with the -l option, use unit suffixes: Byte, Kilobyte, Megabyte, Gigabyte, Terabyte and Petabyte in order to reduce the number of digits to four or fewer using base 2 for sizes.
options.gnu_desc: with -l and -s, print sizes like 1K 234M 2G etc.
options.notes: Human readable sizes. eza defaults to --bytes, so -h disables it

options.name: follow_symlinks
options.bsd_desc: Symbolic links on the command line are followed. This option is assumed if none of the -F, -d, or -l options are specified.
options.gnu_desc: follow symbolic links listed on the command line

options.name: inode
options.bsd_desc: For each file, print the file's file serial number (inode number).
options.gnu_desc: print the index number of each file

options.name: ignore_pattern
options.bsd_desc: Prevent -A from being automatically set for the super-user. This option is not defined in IEEE Std 1003.1-2008 ("POSIX.1").
options.gnu_desc: do not list implied entries matching shell PATTERN
options.notes: Do not list implied entries matching PATTERN

options.name: kibibytes
options.bsd_desc: This has the same effect as setting environment variable BLOCKSIZE to 1024, except that it also nullifies any -h options to its left.
options.gnu_desc: default to 1024-byte blocks for file system usage; used only with -s and per directory totals

options.name: long_format
options.bsd_desc: (The lowercase letter "ell".) List files in the long format.
options.gnu_desc: use a long listing format

options.name: dereference
options.bsd_desc: Follow all symbolic links to final target and list the file or directory the link references rather than the link itself.
options.gnu_desc: when showing file information for a symbolic link, show information for the file the link references rather than for the link itself

options.name: numericid
options.bsd_desc: Display user and group IDs numerically rather than converting to a user or group name in a long (-l) output.
options.gnu_desc: like -l, but list numeric user and group IDs
options.notes: List numeric user and group IDs

options.name: no_quoting
options.gnu_desc: print entry names without quoting

options.name: no_group
options.bsd_desc: List in long format, but omit the group id.
options.gnu_desc: like -l, but do not list group information

options.name: dir_slash
options.bsd_desc: Write a slash ('/') after each filename if that file is a directory.
options.gnu_desc: append / indicator to directories

options.name: reverse
options.bsd_desc: Reverse the order of the sort.
options.gnu_desc: reverse order while sorting
options.notes: Reverse the order of the sort

options.name: recursive
options.bsd_desc: Recursively list subdirectories encountered.
options.gnu_desc: list subdirectories recursively

options.name: size
options.bsd_desc: Display the number of blocks used in the file system by each file.
options.gnu_desc: print the allocated size of each file, in blocks
options.notes: Print allocated size of each file

options.name: sort_size
options.bsd_desc: Sort by size (largest file first) before sorting the operands in lexicographical order.
options.gnu_desc: sort by file size, largest first
options.notes: Sort by size (largest first). eza sorts smallest first, so --reverse is added

options.name: sort_time
options.bsd_desc: Sort by descending time modified (most recently modified first). If two files have the same modification timestamp, sort their names in ascending lexicographical order.
options.gnu_desc: sort by time, newest first; see --time
options.notes: Sort by modification time, newest first

options.name: full_time
options.bsd_desc: When printing in the long (-l) format, display complete time information

options.name: access_time_sort
options.bsd_desc: Use time of last access, instead of time of last modification of the file for sorting (-t) or long printing (-l).
options.gnu_desc: with -lt: sort by, and show, access time; with -l: show access time and sort by name; otherwise: sort by access time, newest first

options.name: created_time
options.bsd_desc: Use time when file was created for sorting or printing

options.name: version
options.gnu_desc: output version information and exit

options.name: width
options.bsd_desc: Force raw printing of non-printable characters. This is the default when output is not to a terminal.
options.gnu_desc: set output width to COLS. 0 means no limit

options.name: across
options.bsd_desc: The same as -C, except that the multi-column output is produced with entries sorted across, rather than down, the columns.
options.gnu_desc: list entries by lines instead of by columns
options.notes: List entries by lines instead of columns

options.name: extension
options.gnu_desc: sort alphabetically by entry extension

options.name: context
options.gnu_desc: print any security context of each file

options.name: extended
options.bsd_desc: Display extended attribute keys and sizes in long (-l) output.
options.notes: BSD only - display extended attribute keys and sizes

options.name: full_timestamp
options.gnu_desc: like -l --time-style=full-iso

options.name: dirs_first
options.gnu_desc: group directories before files

options.name: hide_pattern
options.gnu_desc: do not list implied entries matching shell PATTERN (overridden by -a or -A)
options.notes: Do not list implied entries matching PATTERN

options.name: hyperlink
options.gnu_desc: hyperlink file names WHEN

options.name: indicator
options.gnu_desc: append indicator with style WORD to entry names: none (default), slash (-p), file-type (--file-type), classify (-F)

options.name: sort_field
options.gnu_desc: change default 'name' sort to WORD: none (-U), size (-S), time (-t), version (-v), extension (-X), name, width

options.name: time_field
options.gnu_desc: select which timestamp used to display or sort; access time (-u): atime, access, use; metadata change time (-c): ctime, status; modified time (default): mtime, modification; birth time: birth, creation

options.name: time_style
options.gnu_desc: time/date format with -l; see TIME_STYLE below

options.name: author
options.gnu_desc: with -l, print the author of each file

options.name: show_acl
options.bsd_desc: Print the Access Control List (ACL) associated with the file, if present, in long (-l) output.

options.name: file_flags
options.bsd_desc: Include the file flags in a long (-l) output.

options.name: no_symlinks
options.bsd_desc: If argument is a symbolic link, list the link itself rather than the object the link references.

options.name: whiteouts
options.bsd_desc: Display whiteouts when scanning directories.

options.name: escape
options.bsd_desc: As -B, but use C escape codes whenever possible.
options.gnu_desc: print C-style escapes for nongraphic characters

options.name: quote_names
options.gnu_desc: enclose entry names in double quotes

options.name: quoting
options.gnu_desc: use quoting style WORD for entry names: literal, locale, shell, shell-always, shell-escape, shell-escape-always, c, escape

options.name: si
options.gnu_desc: likewise, but use powers of 1000 not 1024

options.name: tabsize
options.gnu_desc: assume tab stops at each COLS instead of 8

options.name: no_sort
options.gnu_desc: do not sort directory entries

options.name: nul_output
options.gnu_desc: end each output line with NUL, not newline
